DRAW Client

Deep learning based Radiotherapy Autosegmentation Workflow (DRAW) - Client DocumentationÔÉÅ

Welcome to the Deep learning based Radiotherapy Autosegmentation Workflow (DRAW) - Client Documentation. In this documentation, you will find information on how to use the DRAW client to interact with the DRAW server.

The DRAW client is a Django based application that runs on a computer and allows the user to send DICOM images to the DRAW server for autosegmentation. After the autosegmentation is completed, the DRAW client retrives the RTStructureSet files from the DRAW server and saves them to the correct path.

The DRAW client performs the following major tasks:

  1. It allows the user to configure a directory / folder from which the client will take DICOM data for autosegmentation.

  2. It allows the user to create autosegmentation templates. These templates are created using the data provided from the DRAW server and allow users to quickly modify / adapt the templates to new or updated models.

  3. It allows the user to configure rulesets that determine which autosegmentation template to use for a given DICOM data.

  4. It allows the user to schedule periodic autosegmentation tasks to run at specified intervals.

  5. Before sending the DICOM data to the DRAW server it ensures that the DICOM data is properly deidentifies and associates the autosegmentation templates (selected based on the ruleset or manually) with the DICOM data.

  6. It retrives the RTStructureSet files from the DRAW server and saves them to the correct path after the reidentification is completed.

  7. Finally it allows the users to view the File operations performed by the client.
